summary: This document is an electronic communication from the FBI requesting assistance from the Document Conversion Laboratory for scanning and automation of telephone records related to an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez, who was a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein. The document outlines the procedures for handling and processing these records in support of ongoing investigations.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Rodriguez is the subject of an obstruction of justice case for attempting to sell an address book containing names and numbers of potential underage victims of Epstein instead of turning it over to law enforcement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is the subject of a child prostitution case, and his name is associated with the address book that Rodriguez attempted to sell.

connections.description: Rodriguez was employed as the house manager and butler for Epstein.

events.title: Obstruction of Justice Case Opened
events.description: The Miami Division opened an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez was the former house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein.
Rodriguez attempted to sell an address book containing names and numbers of potential underage victims instead of turning it over to law enforcement.
The obstruction of justice case against Rodriguez was opened in October 2009.
The document outlines procedures for scanning and processing telephone records related to the case.
Rodriguez's actions are linked to the ongoing investigation into Epstein's activities.
